characters: WE FLASH FORWARD TO AN IMAGINARY SCENE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE MEET: MUMBLES(late 30s) and ONE TWO (late 30s). They a listening to a sales pitch from two REAL ESTATE AGENTS. We SEE all the relevant pictures of their pitch explainin changing city, LONDON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years ago this property cost one million pounds. (we SEE building)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, it costs five million. The camera WHIP PANS over to another part of the building see the other ESTATE AGENT giving his pitch. The camera will keep this back and forth for the duration of the sce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did this happen? (CUT TO relevant pictures as he speaks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attractive tax opportunities for foreign investment, restrictive building consent and massive hedge fund bonuses,... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: London, my good man, is fast becoming the financial and cultural capital of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course the Russians have come to town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes it hard to compete with an ex- Soviet oligarch that has six billion dollars in his back pocket. They don't haggle the price, they double the price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russians come, prices rise, and it doesn't stop. It only goes one way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't teach you how to skin a cat, but I can tell you a lot about the money in bricks and mortar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like he said, it's going one way. You need to see a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: One Two and Mumbles look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to see a Lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO a modern looking LAWYER'S office.   We SEE the LAW advising MUMBLES AND ONE TWO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say it's only going one way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE TWO and the LAWYER are here looking at the building, is a bit dilapidated and bleak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a great deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut back into the office where the LAWYER lays out the building plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the plans,...it costs ten and it'll be worth twenty with planning. But first you gotta give the councilor a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO the desk of a COUNCILOR (mid thirties middle management)who is receiving a brown envelope from the LAW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the envelope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them they'll get the planning,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT BACK to our LAWYER now smug.    One Two and Mumble standing in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get the planning. Take care of the councilor and it will move like shit through a goose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny Cole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dog number one,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he moves fast and he loves bricks and mortar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEET LENNY COLE(50s, dark, a little tubby), Mumbles and O Two are here. Lenny's office is kitsch, he fancies himsel as a man of class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do move fast and I love bricks and mortar, properties are always the safe bet, but you better know what you're doing 'cos this ain't soft money. You trip up,... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's not me that's gonna get hurt. You got security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me down boys. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on then, give us your hand. They shake hands and sign the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Councilor is the phone to the Lawyer.      He speaks tones clandestine like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't talk now, but there has been a problem. I can't get you the planning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lawyer is on the phone with Mumbles and One Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry boys, can't get the planning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One two is on the phone.      He looks over to Mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't get the planing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't get the planing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny is looking out to One Two and Mumbles who are stand outside his car looking very white. Lenny screams from th back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you can't get the fuckin planning? (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is seven million of my cash in there, without planning it's worth five,...you owe me. I take the building, you lose your share, but I am still outta pocket two large ones. Find it. The window goes up and the car pulls off.      Lenny pick his phone, he dials huffing and puffing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you Councilor? (Lenny smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you got that car you was after,....now, sort the planning out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorted Lenny. He puts the phone down and looks over smiling.     MEET A (Lenny's right hand man, 50s).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you Arch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a bit strong isn't it Len? They come from the same place as you, you'll clean 'em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same place as me? Do I look like an immigrant Archy? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one gave me a leg up, did they? They need a bit of fear, 'cos otherwise they're gonna come up against me,...need a little lesson don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two and Mumbles are here, it's quiet until,..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta sell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And be left with what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just gotta start again,.... FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start CREDITS over sports arena entrance. Lenny is being walked down a corridor, the      walls are with photographs of old soccer stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                             4

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On each side of him are two ESCORTS(ex-military types, he looking). As they pass each door, we realize where ever h is going, it has to be important. The ESCORTS talk in to their microphones and to the different GUARDS on each doo way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Every now and then we see the SPORTS ARENA in the back gr At last we reach the main door to the head office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door is opened we see a small crowd of MEN in suit gathered around a kind-looking MAN with bright blue eyes. He nods a couple of times. We CUT TO the front of Lenny who is clearly impressed, Mr Blue eyes pays him no attention. The small crowd of busin MEN shake hands and head to the door at which Lenny is wa patiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on the back of URI (Russian Jew, 40s, slick, and well groomed, he is our Mr. Blue Eyes) overlooking his sp arena. We stay on the back of Uri's head while he is talk to Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you could join us here Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to see you Uri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (there is a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see we are very much alike you and I Lenny. We like to get things done. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it going to cost me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, let me make clear how much we can help you benefit from this deal. With out me, it will take you five to ten years to get the permission to erect your arena. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second, with Government policy as it so stands we both know it's unlikely that you'd ever get that consent. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirdly, in legal fees, transactions and building consent, you'd be paying 6 to 12 million without any real guarantee of that result. We CUT TO Uri unfazed, he just wants the figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                           5A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Lenny,..... how much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven million Euros. Still unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect a guarantee that I have consent within six months and no red tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right Uri, you can consider that done. Pause while tension stews, then,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink!     Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uri walks to the bar. Lenny follows trying to contain his excitement, he's out of his league, a "welcome to the billionaires club" look has struck him pink. Lenny passes PICTURE that's sat on an EASEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's a nice picture Uri, hasn't it got, errrh depth? Uri is at the bar now. He has placed one large tumbler do and is pouring a very very large measure out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That picture has brought me nothing but luck Lenny,..it's my lucky picture. (he has a good idea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like? Take it for a while, maybe it will give you luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I couldn't Uri,... Still absorbed with the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're partners, I insist. I will get it sent around to your house and you can give it back to me when our deal is finalized. Lenny looks at the bar. Uri motions, there is a SMALL KEG of WHISKEY on the bar and only one large glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you lot drunk Vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whiskey is the new Vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You not joining me Uri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh,...cheers then,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To success. Lenny awkwardly starts to glug as Uri looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny enters the back seat of his car, Archy is waiting f him in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right there Len?      You look a little pink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Flustered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turbo, get us a perrier and a wet wipe live-o. Lenny's panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tried to poison me the dirty Cossack... TURBO (Lenny's driver) is fumbling around in the front se trying to get ice into a glass from the cooler that sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop messing about and give us the bottle Turbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how's the billionaires club? Lenny grabs the drink, desperately takes a big glug of wa and wipes his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Communism didn't seem to slow 'em down did it? We've hit the big time here Archy boy! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Where's the old Archy smile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna watch out there. Times are changing, they don't have too much respect for the old school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Archy,... (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No school like the old school,...I still run this town see? That's why he came to me right? Got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, got that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uri looks at VICTOR (Uri's right hand man).   They're loo down at Lenny's disappearing car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you should have leant him your lucky picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes the peasant feel royal,... don't spoil it, we need him at the moment. I want that consent. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the accountant and get her to clear the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man and woman sit on one side of a desk, MEET STELLA AN BERTIE. Bertie is 45 and handsome in a dark posh sort of way. Stella is 32, film star. Sitting opposite them are two TAX MEN(civil servant types, grey, middle aged, a lit tubby and bald). There's a stand off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, can we shut the door? There's a pause while the TAX MAN looks at his colleague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the door. His colleague gets up and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's put our cards on the table. We both know you aren't going to get the full forty out of my clients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the tax office and in the end we get what we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save that speech for the tourists Charlie and let's strike a deal - take the twenty now and let it go. Otherwise, they'll move the company off shore tomorrow and you'll spend the next twenty years chasing an imaginary forty million around every republic that grows bananas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bertie lifts out papers from his brief case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see why you married her now Bertie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two TAX MEN look at each other, they're thinking the same thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you we'd make a great team,.. You know why you get those deals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks relatively bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because those fat, sad, old men like it when you swear at them. They shake like cocktails and sweat like semtex when you raise that posh little voice. You my love are a rare commodity. (beat) Now come on, give your Bertie a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel like smiling. I am a thirty two year old accountant married to a homosexual lawyer. (beat) I'm a beard without kids Bertie! I'm in a marriage of convenience that can be quite inconvenient at times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings, Bertie picks it up and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she's right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                       9A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he puts his hand over the receiver) It's Omovich. (mincey) Are you sure he isn't gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Introduction of the SPEELER. A location of all things nefarious, a place to scam, buy and sell things illegal, play cards. MUMBLES and ONE TWO own the Speeler. MEET Handsome Bob (mid thirties, part of the gang Errrh Handso FRED THE HEAD(late 40s) he runs it with DOLLY(early 50s, maternal figure, cleaner and chef). These are the main players in a room of never less than TEN rarely no more t TWENTY people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't do a five, they've got nothing on you Handsome Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about Fred? They got an informer, a grass, and a rat with a roach-smoking-a canary,..they've got more information than the fuckin Internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Language,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like I said, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone Fred, you're stressing him out. Dolly get him a cuppa tea. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on deal the cards Fred. We see in the background someone coming in. MEET COOKIE(l 30s, slicked back, black hair), his look is a bit of a pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right chaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right Cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to be dealt in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't stay for long, but throw us in for a quick spin. One Two, who has been on the phone finishes his call. looks over to Mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                      10A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mumbles, can I have a word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the lady, the posh one who likes abitta the rough life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The accountant, what about her? You haven't heard from her in a while, too dangerous that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says she's got some work, you know,... proper work. (he makes gun impression)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would normally turn her down, but considering,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella's here admiring an abstract picture of nothingness One Two sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one like that at home with a little boy fishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what they call humor where you come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't they call that art where you come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quite the entertainer aren't you Mr. One Two? And you are late, please don't be late, I have a very busy schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -    6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some work and thought you'd be interested, its your kind of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two accountants taking out seven million Euros from a bank I know and it won't be protected. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty percent for me, as normal. The details are in here. She passes an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes,..I don't want this coming back to me so, if you could give them a black eye,..that might help. She see's a slight pause and look of concern from One Two

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black eye, nothing more. She passes him an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, very good Mrs. Dexter, a black eye it is then. He looks down at her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why thank you, you'll be able to afford your own pair in a couple of days. Good bye. He watches her walk off, he likes her, she likes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guys are here counting money. MEET ROMAN and MICKEY, two black Americans. (Mid 30s dressed very classy, with a bit of an urban twist) They are in the managing game, exploiting the talents of the English. The sound of distant bass thudding through the walls can heard while Mickey is on the phone trying to do some kind business. A real ROCKER with long hair and good looks com walking in distressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision       -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the dry ice Mickey, I need the dry ice. My show just doesn't work without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hand over the receiver) If you told me yesterday you needed dry ice, I would have gotten you the driest ice the world could offer, but you didn't ask for no dry ice. You asked for two cases of Johnny Walker black label and four ladies of the pole and I got them for you didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pause from the Rocker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did I do confess, but Mickey, you're the manager and I am the rocker. You've got on the managers hat, now pluck something out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hat is deep and full of magic. I got rabbits, handkerchiefs, and ladies of the pole drinking Black Label. I got smoke machines, bubble machines, I even got love marines and still the hat goes deeper, but....there ain't no mother fuckin dry ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, ok, come home, you've made your point. (he turns on his way out) But tomorrow, I need dry ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROMAN looks up from his paper, having not got involved in the slightest. Roman taps the paper he has been reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you read this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reads out the headlines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Story singer extraordinaire, fell off a boat, they say. Missing, assumed dead, they say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What,..our Johnny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many rock stars by the name of Johnny Story do you think there are in this universe Mickey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing he's fallen off is his junkies spoon, he's no deader than the suit you're wearing now. He'll be gearing himself up somewhere happy as clam in a fisherman's net. Rockers like that never die, they just wither and give me pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the tennis court we see the COUNCILOR(our man from the beginning), who is playing tennis with TERRY THE INSTRUCT The Councilor is taking it seriously apart from the distraction of JACKIE on the next door court. ARCHY is he watching over the game and reading the paper, we see him read an article and look a little moved. Lenny comes up behind him and starts to read over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Story singer extraordinare, fell off a boat, missing, assumed dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he took a lot of people with him in his hot little crack pipe. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will never mention this again, all right Arch? Archy looks a little shocked.     Lenny carries on like n has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, tell the Councilor to stop fuckin about with sticks and balls and send him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                            14

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lenny walks into the bar and Archy moves on to the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good councilor, you must of had lessons as a boy. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fancy a cool down and a chat with Lenny? The Councilor slyly looks over to Jackie, she looks back. The Councilor is thinking explicit thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know Jackie? Nervous, the Councilor knows these thugs aren't shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, Archy, don't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, she's a friend,..and a member. (raises his voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie,..fancy a run'a'round with the Councilor? Pause.   She looks sullen, stroppy and rude all at the sa time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if he's wicked. She turns away to hit a ball, the Councilor's heart skips beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited and shy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she mean by that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she likes you boy-o.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny is at the bar on his own looking at the papers and picking at the nuts. In walks the Councilor with Archy, t Councilor sits next to Lenny at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say that times are changing Councilor, that this country isn't what it used to be, it's the new New York, they say. You being a political man must know all about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                          15A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Councilor looks a bit flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Errh, I think they are probably right, times have changed, but that shouldn't affect you Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say it's all gone "international" now, out with the old guard in with the new, but I think they're wrong. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, where are my manners? Look at you sweaty as a native and pink as a pelican,...and I haven't even offered you a wet one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lemonade and orange please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's nice,..refreshing, that'll put you back on top boy. Lenny pulls out the plans and a leather pack of cigars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, plans and papers. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a cigar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind if I do,...that's a nice lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight grand they wanted for it cheeky toads and I paid, you know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cos it's all about the details. Looking at the plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkwardly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is our little deal in there too Lenny? Lenny milks the silence while he lights his cigar, the Councilor feels like a prick waiting, it goes on and on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                           16

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I wouldn't forget that, the most important things first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He puts the Dunhill lighter down on the plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave you with them. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta run, can't stay here chewing the fat all day, a mans got to make a living. Call me in the 'morrow. He walks toward the door as Jackie is walking in, Lenny l slyly at her as they pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look after him Jackie. In the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Lenny, you forgot your lighter. Lenny looks back to the Councilor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be mine, it's got your name on it. CUT TO the bottom of the lighter, "THE COUNCILOR." Lenny carries on walking and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the next morning, we SEE One Two running. Mumbles an Handsome Bob pull up along side of him in their car. Ther is a moment of pause while they admire One Two running al side of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get bored of that? I mean, your not really going anywhere. If you wanna run, why don't you run to the shops or do something useful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could do with some of this yourself Mumbles, you're letting yourself go. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I'm busy, have you come to talk about anything important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all about the zone isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys and girls like to find funny places in your head where nothing can get you, don't you? You're scared, you're running away from yourself One Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Mumbles, I am trying to run away from you. Bob, you sorted out the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it looks like a heap of shit, but it can't half go. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit like you One Two. Mumbles turns to Handsome Bob

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reckon he's trying to get fit for the lady. Nothing gets under his skin like a lady he can't have, does it? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A straight going, cocky, educated, arrogant posh bird trips him right up. I reckon we should set Handsome Bob on her. That'll liven you up One Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob wouldn't know where to begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good with the posh ones, don't you worry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had enough of this, can you two piss off cos I am trying to find my "zone" One Two sprints off leaving them behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't half run for a white fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny is pacing in a ladies dressing gown with long silk socks. He can't sleep, he pours a large one, lights a cig picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archy? You awake? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind, you are now. I had a horrible dream that the Councilor didn't come through, I don't want anything going wrong on this one, that Russian's the key to the big time. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) You sure? (beat) What did Jackie say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His feet go back up on the desk with confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did? I knew he'd like the lighter, nice touch eh? She's a good girl that Jackie. (laughing) Give her another drink. (beat) You're right, he wouldn't have leant me his lucky painting if he didn't mean business. Yeah, I had it taken off it's easel and stuck it above my desk, it's looks magnifi....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly stops. His eyes have spotted something scary, the office chair disappears from under him, he takes the phone, the lamp, and the ash tray with him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the floor) Arch! Arch! I have been robbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the receiver the right way round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I have been robbed. (beat) I don't know when. The painting,.. it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands fumbling and screaming, his scotch all over him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one Uri gave me! (beat) All right LOANED for fucks sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat while panic sets in and Archy is saying something on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't good Arch, it's his favorite painting, his lucky painting! Get round here and bring the troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                            19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny's still pacing, a small gathering of tired looking HOOLIGANS are lined up in Lenny's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was it Len? Lenny is standing in front of the fire place smoking and looking very anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There is a bald spot above his head where a picture once stood, a picture light illuminates an clearly empty space He is horrified by the stupidity of the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a wild stab in the dark shall we Bandy? Archy slap him and then send him to school 'cos I can't take any more of this. You sort it out, get that picture back and bring me a body, I am going to back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stomps off to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandy if you ever ask a stupid question like that again, you see Danny there? He's gonna slap you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Arch, it's just,...I was trying to use initiative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny slap him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY slaps him with the back of his left hand.       Arc happy - it was the wrong hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the right Danny,..properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY slaps him again, it's weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said properly, with the back of your right hand Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this a tennis match Arch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slap him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY slaps him again, BANDY takes it good. Archy huffs a goes over to slap him proper, SLAP! Bandy's disappeared into another dimension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                            2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if you men can master a slap like that, there's no need for your clients to hold back. They'll open up like a fountain full of words after one of those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need for strong violence, no no, they're straight back to their childhood. Putty in your hands, ask Bandy,... (motioning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, thinks he's back at school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he never went to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, do you want a slap as well? Now, if the slap doesn't work,..Cut 'em...or pay 'em, but keep the receipts 'cos this ain't the Mafia. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, get to work and find that painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mumbles, Handsome Bob, and One Two are standing here dres as security guards. Handsome Bob is watching over the car that is waiting for the TWO ACCOUNTANTS to come out of th back door of the warehouse. One Two and Mumbles are to th side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup, load up boys and pay attention. One Two see's the door open and makes a move. Two ACCOUNT come out of the back door, while in route they click thei central locking open on the car waiting. One Two is alrea on them as the ACCOUNTANTS go to open their car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello lads. He flashes the gun in his belt. The ACCOUNTANTS are too shocked to even know what is going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the bags in the car and walk away. The ACCOUNTANTS see the gun, but still look for a way out Mumbles meets them with another gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly boys, do as you are told. Put the bags in the car, give him the keys and walk away smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The ACCOUNTANTS do as they are told. One Two and Mumbles get into the car, calm as you like. One Two, starts the engine, but he can't find reverse. There is a crunching sound from the car, the accountants stop and look round. One Two puts down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the accountants)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi, come back here. The ACCOUNTANTS come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's reverse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to lift up the nob under the gear stick. One Two struggles, then finds the gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, now fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to accountants)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly and keep smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have got to hurt him. (to the Accountants)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi come back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What did he ever do to you? Come on we've got the money now let's piss off! The Accountant has made his away back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? One Two goes through the motions getting ready to hit the accountant without actually being able to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                            2

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: One Two wheels spins out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mumbles and One Two take off driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an embarrassment to crime you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She asked me to give him a black eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sick that bird of yours, sick. Quickly changing the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Handsome Bob behind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uri is walking around looking over one his sites, he's entertaining a corporate gathering of MEN all in suits an hard hats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The developement has been underway for four years and will be completed within another two. The area covers twelve acres and it will become one of Londons premiere residences. We can SEE VICTOR (Uri's right hand man) in the backgroun looking anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty two floors and six acres,....excuse me gentlemen,.. Uri walks over to VICTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Victor leans in and whispers to Uri.    After 15 seconds leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Do they know who we are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) It's not like the old country, it's cowboys and Indians out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) We don't have time to play games,..people and business are waiting. Speak to the accountant and get some more money. (beat) And Victor, this time no problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella is here again looking at the abstract pictures on wall. One Two joins her, he's got a largish Louis Vuitton with the money and her twenty percent in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a man that'll copy that for you. Might take him a couple of minutes mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to copy anything any more, welcome to the nouveau riche Mr. One Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's one for you too Mrs Dexter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why thank you Mr. One Two. I see you didn't think much of the black eye though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would have liked to obliged, but from a professional point of view, it just wasn't natural,... (pause) Until next time then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                        23A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She turns and walks away, he looks slyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Bob is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a looker ain't she One Two? One Two picks up his phone and starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not for you Bob, that is class. Someone picks up at the other end of the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archy, I got Lenny's bitta scratch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turbo is driving Archy, who is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you got it all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and it's burning a hole in the floor, so you better come and get it before it melts my boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come round the speeler. Archy's phone beeps - he has an incoming call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got another call, gotta go. Archy switches calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny is pacing, he's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archy, the Russian didn't come through with the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down Len, the Councilor can wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Some good news for you, One Two and Co came through with the scratch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, all of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, all of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did they get that from then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask no questions hear no lies. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just gotta do is find your painting now Len.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny's phone beeps - he has an incoming call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make sure you find it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta another call. He switches calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Councilor is on his mobile, speaking in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have all my people waiting Lenny. You can't let me down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a delay, that's all Councilor. Just a delay. He puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT back to Archy in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop here Turbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                            25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archy gets out of the car and on to the street which is p with theater goers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision       -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He has seen someone he knows, a dodgy looking ticket sell GARY moves between the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Arch. What brings you down here? Want some tickets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the Tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't see him on the cobbles at this time of night, you know how much he likes the cold. He's at the end of the street tucked up watching a Zulu movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archy knocks on window of massive American 4x4. The windo comes down, savage noises emanate from the interior, a ma black bald head turns, MEET TANK very street, very soft s and very articulate. He's sitting next to a SHAVAWN a str girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Arch, what you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't stand out there on the cobbles it's freezing, step into my world. (too the girl) Shavawn get us a couple of vanilla chai lattes, there's a good girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great movie this Arch. They've had it digitally re-mastered, glorious picture and the sounds exquisite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the remote, the sound goes up so all we can he is the sound of spears on shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I like this bit, thousands and thousands of 'em, but them red coats just don't move. That's courage that is Arch. (beat) They did have guns mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of screaming and death is penetrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it down a tad, I need to have a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tank flicks the pause button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my manners? Sorry Arch, what do you want, tickets? I got just the show for you, a Chinese orphan with a learning disability that don't stop singing and dancing all the way through the first half. Then, up pops a Geisha girl and it all goes magical in the second; the wife will love it and you can't get tickets for love nor,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want tickets, I need you to find me a painting, a classic, been nicked outta of Lenny's house. And since you got more feet on the street than coppers on the beat,... (starting to make his way out) I'd like you to assist. I'll leave you a little livener. There's a large twenty to get some tongues wagging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the boys are sitting around playing cards. The buzzer goes, buzzzzzzzzzzz, Fred answers the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah,...? (beat) Come on up, but don't be wasting my time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Archy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, couple of oysters who got a little something to be viewed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He presses the button and walks back to the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your Mum taking it Handsome? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must be very unhappy, I mean a five stretch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not again, please Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Bob, I didn't mean to offend. In the background we see the door open and in comes two thieving SCOTSMEN, they are selling fur coats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants another cuppa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his cup)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass of milk for me, my love. Our thieves move over to the table. MEET our cocky Scotsm MALCOLM and his partner in crime PAUL. Malcolm drops his bags and starts to get busy. He's got a strong Scottish accent that has been influenced by last nights crack for dinner and two large whisky's for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon gentlemen. He coughs nervously as the boys look on dead pan.    He s Dolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me my love, any chance of a wee dram of water to oil the larynx?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cough)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok gentlemen here we go. First, my colleague Paul will be modeling the grey wolf. We see Paul who's obviously completely geared out of his nut, he's trying to squeeze in to the stolen grey wolf fu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                          28A

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: coat. It's far too small and the fur stops half way up hi arms, it's not possible to do the buttons up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must apologize for my assistants handicaps. He has unusually long arms and an alarmingly small neck. (beat, the crowd is unimpressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I do agree it doesn't seem like the right time to acquire a coat of such thermal efficiency. However, I have been informed that we are looking at a very white winter. PLUS gentlemen and fine lady,.. (He winks at Dolly who has got him a very large glass of water)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas is always round the corner. He downs the water without it touching the sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you find these two junkies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, a fuckin double act?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and tell us the price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All in good time gentlemen, all in good time. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, why don't you sit down for a while. If Paul doesn't sit down, he's gonna fall down. He stumbl into the card table on his way to a seat, knocking drinks and cards everywhere. Everyone protests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from under the table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next, we have a very much sought after affair seen in very, very glossy magazines,.. He jumps up wearing the most ridiculously oversized fur c and matching hat you have ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The famous, but rare black bear from the dark mountains of Siberian Calcutta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts to do a slow spin, at which point WE SEE a larg white stipe running down the furs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get an eye full of that stripe gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a look at that, it's a six foot skunk. Everyone thinks its very fuckin funny.     The laughter i interrupted only by the buzzer. Buzzzzzzzzzz, Fred goes to answers the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all of this could be yours for a staggeringly low,... Cut to Fred at the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right Arch. Back to the table, everyone's ears prick up at the name. Malcolm pauses before he panics, he can tell something is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, come on up. Everyone starts tucking their money into their pockets. Fred makes his way back to the table. He speaks to Malcol and Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two out, live-o. (gesturing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door. Malcolm knows this is a sign to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Paul, we'll be going now. The two Scotsmen race in their fur coats toward the back door. IN WALKS Archy with Danny, the crew continue their card game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right Arch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred,... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speelers very quiet today, everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good as gold thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right Mumbles?       One Two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch! Pause while the boys carry on playing cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is it then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
