dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin hell Len, he's given you that bar tan again. You wanna leave that vodka alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Arch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's fuckin not all right, he want's his painting, his lucky painting. Archy looks a little worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. That's a bit of a problem then isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have seen his eyes I swore they changed color, went fuckin red they did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't care who's soil they are on that lot. They can buy half the country without breaking a sweat, you're small time to them. They could click their fingers and we'd be ether. Turning very nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak to me like that again and I'll cut your fuckin tongue out. I run this town, got that, me! Anybody who thinks he's rude enough, let 'em raise a finger, 'cos I'll take off his whole fuckin arm. Do you understand that Archy? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said do YOU? Archy thinks his boss is going mad, but he doesn't let on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do Len.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are still reeling from the news that Johnny is Lenny's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that then, Johnny Story's father? How did that get under the radar? Why doesn't anybody know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision   -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you want anyone to know that he was your Dad? Would we have taken him on if we had known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have to give him something, anything, a bed that's been slept in, a bone for his dog, some token of effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to see Cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens Mumbles, One Two, Cookie, and Fred stand t A man, TOM in black tie opens the door, he looks posh and in his boxers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A bit rude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?                                              He looks the boys up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be with Stella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're with the Grand Old Duke of York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can't come in here, not                          without shaking my hand.                                  He offers it to One Two who accepts. Tom pulls it back at the last minute and greases his hair back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're supposed to be a hard case                      eh?                                                       Tom disappears inside where we see a mass of extremely dr TOFFS running around going wild in black tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to One Two)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna be a scream, Fred get                       'em in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is talking about drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cos you look like one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're mad this lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision   -   6-20-07                         48B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And take that chewing gum off your feet before you start dancing. Stella approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the boys give it the "oh you sly one" to One Two. The a gathering of TOFFS starting to cluster, they're waiting be fed. A semi naked WAITER appears with a drinks tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourselves to drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching for street cred) So! Who the man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's your cue Cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cookie takes his cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on then kids, get in a nice orderly line and we'll get the party started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys all head various ways into the party

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see One Two walking through the party, when he runs in Handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well all the chaps were coming and I didn't have any plans tonight did I? Thought I might celebrate a little, do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do fuckin mind. Now listen Bob, what happened last night is our little secret all right and it was only cos you were supposed to be doing your time, right? You tell anybody and I swear to God,.... I swear to God. Well fuck it Bob, I think you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As One Two walks away he runs into Tom again who stands i his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something hard case,                    if you start any trouble around                         her,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two gives him the quick ONE TWO punch, Tom is knocked out cold, he catches him standing up and lowers him to th floor. One Two walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision   -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT TO Mumbles on the sofa who is watching One Two, he grimaces. Bertie is next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's why they call him One                         Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're part of the wild bunch? Stella says you're dangerous. Mumbles smiles and flicks his cigar ash into Bertie's gla He knows he's a poof and keeps his eyes on him a second t long just to get Bertie excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is your friend part of the wild bunch? Bertie is talking about Handsome and Mumbles knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That young man is the greatest gun slinger in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Bertie smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come I don't know him? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all about your type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a criminal lawyer,..and I know a secret about your part of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What secrets that then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have an informer in your neck of the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, so what's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to pay for secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision       -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not nice, but while your at it, what's the price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he looks to Handsome) I want to meet the gun slinger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mumbles looks over to Handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO One two who has just run into Stella, there is a m holding a tray of drinks next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large one,...Dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're a dancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I a dancer? Shall we put the record straight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two makes room in front of him and starts to dance relativity badly. You get the feeling he probably could dance, but he just can't be bothered to make an effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see it's all in the genes. (he slowly turns) My Dad was a dancer and his Dad before that so gradually it's percolated the old DNA. You not joining me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I like to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up and dances just like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, I can sense a little competition. So what you got for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same job's back on again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yea? (beat) Don't throw my rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same time, same place, same money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same as before, but they're not my accountants. A couple of their's,..other than that, should be just the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT TO Mumbles who has gone up to Handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome, I got a job for you.    See that man on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one that's staring at us?    How can I miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, chat him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off what do think I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's some big wig lawyer who knows about an informer in our part of town and since you were just looking at a five stretch, I thought you might be interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome gets the picture and heads over to Bertie. appears and approaches Mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got another job on, same as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all go around here isn't it? Den of iniquity this place is. You know your old lady, well her big time lawyer husband he's a beard got a crush on the Handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it this way, I don't think they married for love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get a breath of fresh air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT TO to Handsome who has come to sit on the same sof as Bertie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I hear you have a secret, but you look like you might have more than one. Why don't you confess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you tell me who the informer is, we will talk about whatever you want to, anyway, you don't have to tell me anything. If he's an informer you'll have his depositions and poems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, my not just a pretty face. How do you know about those sort of things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome scribbles out his number on a piece of paper, an gives it to Bertie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a drink during the week, and I'll tell you all about it, all I need is a little bit of paper work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -    6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: 69A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: One Two is on his way out the door when Cookie stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi One Two, I am going to make a killing out of this lot, they've definitely got more money than brains. (to One Two) I owe you one boyo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is watching cartoons trying to skin up a joint usi a page of a book, he puts it down in frustration. Pete wa in, grabs the picture from it's place and starts to walk out. Johnny squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro?   Come back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you are going with that painting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's flapping) You never said it was your Dad's or whatever you wanna call him. You gotta give it back John people are looking for it, bad people. The streets are alive with the sound of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may have a point Pete, but I can't give it up. You know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me in the pub in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny walks in and approaches the BARMAN.        He does Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, now no need for that tone bar steward. I am merely on mission to acquire a shot of your finest Scotch and a packet of your,... (pointing to paper's) Cheapest rolling paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green or red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King size of course - along with a packet of your shiniest coffin nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARMAN reaches for a pack of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make a scene in here boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny puts a large note on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the change in the blind box my good man and remember,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans into the bar and shuts one eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In the kingdom of the blind, the one eyed man is king"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARMAN is left with his mouth open. Johnny walks to t piano to drink his Scotch. There are a few beer mats on t piano, Johnny wipes the mats off with a glide of his hand and they fall to the floor. He raises the lid, coughs, composes himself, and extends his hands through his sleev He hits the first note and takes his scotch down in one. few of the old PUNTERS turn around. Johnny starts to play the most beautiful classical music with his eyes shut. Pe walks in, approaches Johnny and sits with him. He likes i when he plays. Johnny doesn't even need to see him to kno that he's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that pack of Virginia killing sticks at the end of the piano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE the pack of cigarette's on the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                          53A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you need to know about life is retained within those four walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-15-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pete picks up the pack as Johnny keeps his eyes shut. The following story is a montage of pack shots of the cigaret box, intercut with Johnny's delicate fingers stroking the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will notice that one of your personalities is seduced by the illusions of grandeur. A "gold" packet of "king" size and with a "regal" insignia. An attractive implication toward glamour and wealth, a subtle suggestion that cigarettes are indeed your "royal" and loyal friends. And that Pete,...is a lie. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your other personality is trying to draw your attention to the flip side of the discussion. Written in boring, bold, black and white is the statement, that these neat little soldiers of death, are in fact, trying to "kill you." And that Pete,...is the truth. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty is a beguiling call to death and I am addicted to the sweet siren of its pitch. And that,..is why,..you and I love the crack, and that is also why I can not,.. give that painting back. He opens his eyes and looks at Pete, his cigarette has go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, please pass me a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mock awe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you are something special Johnny Story. Johnny smiles and puts him in a head lock, they fall to t floor wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two and Mumbles are here eating and holding their implements of destruction to be used on the next "job" we SEE the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll use rock salt in the shot gun cartridges. Slip 'em into the revolver, if it starts getting large, we'll bang a couple in to 'em and that'll slow 'em down. They won't know the difference between lead or salt and of course Bob's driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to use Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He's our driver, the A-teams not complete without the driver. (beat) What's happened between you and Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a bit of a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there might be something about Bob you don't know Mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that then?       That he's a poof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Eh?   How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody knows he's a flamer, you're the only one who doesn't. He loves the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) What are you talking about, I am losing orientation here Mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he make a pass at you, is this what this is all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he fuckin did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok so what's the problem? It was supposed to be his last night so you "took care" of him, that's what friends do for one another, well done, I won't tell the chaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute, you won't tell the chaps what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?        Suck his,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop right fuckin there! What is going on here? Does that mean you've sucked his,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you must have touched him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on! I am not fucking gay!           He wanted a dance that's all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you give him one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT TO a shot of One Two dancing a slow dance with Han Bob who looks depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DANCE, yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it a slow dance? One Two trails off,....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has he done to me? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there's something else you should know about our Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, there's more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think looked after your Mum before she died, whilst you were doing a two stretch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) 'Cos it wasn't fuckin me and I am your best pal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was Bob around there six times a week without fail making sure she was looked after. You tore your mums heart out when you went away and Bob did his best to put it back. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you something One Two, if I could be half the human that Bob is and the price was being a poof, I'd think about it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for too long, but I'd have to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looked after my Mum, how come he never told me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cos that's Handsome Bob and he's class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman and Mickey have got a BAND on stage and the place i filling up. Roman is on the phone looking concerned as Mi looks on, he puts the phone down. We CUT TO our BAND playing on stage, modern young punkste Arctic Monkey types. Plenty of attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long line of people outside Roman and Mickey's venue. Johnny and Pete hustle their way through the crowd the BOUNCER pulls them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi you, what do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think we're doing?   We're trying to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home wasters, costs money to get in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes my good man, I am aware of that. Johnny goes for his money, but the BOUNCER pushes him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that Archy on the phone, I think we've got a problem. WE CUT to the BAND smashing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOUNCER is holding Johnny and Pete back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run along junkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oi looky, but no touchy. Johnny pushes the BOUNCERS arm away. The BOUNCER retorts with a slap round the cheek. Pete won't stand for that, h goes for the BOUNCER in a pathetic junkie way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off him you slag, he's class. The BOUNCER smashes a big bouncer punch right on Pete's n Pete shoots back past Johnny and lays in the road, the li starts clapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman is on the phone with Archy, we cut to them mid conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Archy,.... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you, but you can't just shut us down! I've got an act on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny stands over Pete, he notices Johnny's face. Pete's seen this before, he's changing like a madmen about to explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, but worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it John, I'm happy, I'm all right down here mate. Let's call it a night eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show em' fuckin happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the BAND is starting to get louder and faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, we'll find him,.. (still pleading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to keep the club open!   I have four hundred people in here! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare shut us down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny makes for the BOUNCER with menace, the BOUNCER loo at Johnny coming and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fancy some more talent boy? Johnny   keeps coming, he's tiny in comparison, the BOUNC stands   and waits - he's ready. Johnny gives the old two finger   poke to the eyes, the BOUNCER screams in pain an swings   into the ether

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                             6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT TO THE BAND who is going mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny pulls out his signature pencils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to report you, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jog on boy, before I grind your bones to make my bread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a hesitation Johnny sticks the pencils into the BOUNCERS leg, it's quite nasty. The BOUNCER stumbles forw like a wounded elephant, it's David and Goliath. Johnny's smart, he knows how to do this properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I'm sorry did that hurt?   Here let me help you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey walks back to Roman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Roman) They're trying to shut us down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO THE BAND going even madder - the crowd is loving i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny picks up a trash bin lid and starts giving it to t bouncer. The crowd dances around this wounded beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that about grinding bones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we want to keep the licence and the lights on, we need to find Johnny Story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey looks at the security camera and sees chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a revolution taking place outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAND is still going when all of a sudden the lights g pulled, we cut to black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman and Mickey have come to find Cookie. He is with a GROUP of people having dinner including Fred the Head. We cut into him mid joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joke to be inserted by Cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table laughs, Roman and Mickey approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, it's Roman and Mickey, what are you doing here boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we have a word Cookie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to find Johnny Story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you should be the first to know this, but isn't he,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know and I know nothing kills Johnny. (beat) Come on Cookie, you've helped him fuck up his life for the last five years, now do him a good turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This story will be illustrated appropriately, including a little smoking devil holding the burning crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever bought a ticket to the junkies bone yard Roman? (beat) It's an unpleasant place called "curl up and die." Might sound like a hair salon, but it don't fuckin look like one I can tell ya. It's a horrible sight and a terrible sound listening to a man sucking his soul through the hole in "the pipe" and even worse when he tries to tear it back. (beat) I've been there, I've done that,... then I nailed that demon in a smoke proof coffin and I did it all with Johnny. I love that man, he's what you call class..and if you would use your heads, you would love him too. You know his music sales have gone up a thousand percent in two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) You see, Johnny "the crack head" Story knows that a "Rocka" is worth more dead than alive, silly world ain't it? (beat) Mr Story doesn't get his gear from me, he has to travel far and wide. Leave me your number and if the dead feels like calling, you'll be the first to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE inside the Range Rover where there is a DRIVER wit our TWO CHECHNYANS. The CHECHNYANS have suitcases handcuf to their wrists. They speak in their native tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is Uri's right hand man, we served together for four years in Chechnya. We used to have a good time together, he's a real soldier, strong, hard, we made much trouble. I saved his life and he saved mine many times,... CHECHNYAN 1 pulls up his sleeve to reveal a massive tatto His arm is filled with slash marks on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught in tank tracks!      He pulled me out and this one,... He unbuckles his trousers and shows a massive gouge in hi thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stem grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have one of those,... CHECHNYAN 2 pulls up his trouser leg to reveal massive sc on his shin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many of these have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-19-07                             6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chechnyan 1 pulls his shirt up to reveal more wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six thirty calibe,.... SMASH!!!! Their car is smashed into a tailspin, by Handso Bob's truck. The Range Rover eventually lands on it's sid steam, spinning wheels, smoke, and glass is everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob jumps out of his truck and runs down to the second ge car waiting. We SEE One Two and Mumbles get out of their car and run over to the Range Rover on its side, they are carrying an axe and bolt cutters. Inside, CHECHNYAN 2 slo opens his dazed eyes, to SEE an axe chopping through the window. TWO CHOPS and the window gives in. One Two leans in and grabs the case, but it's chained to CHECHNYAN 2's wrist. One Two pulls the arm out of the window and Mumble uses massive bolt cutters to cut the case free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another case, grab it. One Two leans in and grabs the second case from Chechnyan As he is about to chop this one loose, he is pulled into car by CHECHNYAN 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bastard's still kicking.     Mace him, mace him! Mumbles quickly moves around to the other window and spra mace everywhere, including into One Two's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yaaaaaaaaaaaaaa, not me you idiot, the Guerrilla! CHECHNYAN 2 in the mean time has regained some of his str and is still pulling One Two into the car with him. We ca SEE Bob in the distance now next to their second getaway looking concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him, shoot him, the bastards going to eat me! Mumbles pulls out a revolver, sticks it in the window and fires it into CHECHNYAN 2's leg. This just aggravates the CHECHNYAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his arms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arhhhhhhhhhhh.     That's my fuckin arm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two manages to head butt CHECHNYAN 2 and goes back to reclaiming the case from CHECHNYAN 1. He pulls it out and Mumbles cuts the chain. One Two can't see a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, we've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a hand, you've blinded me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major confusion is setting in. They run back to their car which is still running, Mumbles shoves One Two into the b and jumps in the drivers seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go, go, go!!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his window open, Mumbles wheel spins out of the situ and turns to check on One Two. From out of nowhere a very large CHECHNYAN arm shoots through the window and puts Mu in a neck lock. The CHECHNYAN 2 is holding on and not let go. The car tears across the road and enters a shop window th has a mezzanine. The car comes to a halt on a precarious ledge, it's dangling with the CHECHNYAN 2 still not letti go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two can get a clear shot into the CHECHNYAN 2's side. He shots him once, CHECHNYAN 2 doesn't move, twice, three times, four times, he finally lets go and falls down on t floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, what are these two made out of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mumbles is coughing and slowly coming back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hardly see, where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab my hand, we're getting out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got the cases?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got 'em. As they get out of the car, WE SEE CHECHNYAN 1 has now ma his way down the street. He is punch drunk with mace in h eyes, but extracts a machine gun from under his jacket. T boys freeze they are fucked, nowhere to go, but CHECHNYAN is blinking profusely he can't be sure where they are. He lets off a magazine into the manikins next to our boys wh all hit the deck. The magazine runs dry, CHECHNYAN 1 dips into his belt to extract a fresh one. Mumbles see's his opportunity, he grabs a golf club that is standing next t him, runs at CHECHNYAN 1 and takes a massive swipe at his head. CHECHNYAN 1 goes down, but he has already put in a new magazine. Mumbles is still carrying the cases, One Tw is attached to his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him Mumbles or we won't get out of this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't fuckin shoot him, you do it. A baseball smashes into Mumbles face, he goes down, and h out. CHECHNYAN 2 has appeared carrying a metal baseball bat. One Two picks up the machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop or I'll shoot! CHECHNYAN 2 will not stop, he just keeps on coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it, get down,...get down! CHECHNYAN 2 keeps coming, One Two doesn't want to do it b he has to. He lets off twenty three bullets into the CHECHNYAN 2's chest, the CHECHNYAN is knocked back and disappears over the mezzanine. One Two is in shock, he ha never killed a man. He stands there numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (who has come back to life)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the cases, now let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                        68A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pause.   One Two is still in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now One Two, now! They make their way to the entrance. There is a crowd of PEOPLE gathered, a great "ohhhhhhhh" goes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Bob? Beep. Beep. A car slowly makes it way through the crowd. It pulls up and the boys pile in, what's left of them. Th pull away from the sports shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks in his mirror, he can see a gun being raised, t is someone on the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down. He slams on the brakes. CHECHNYAN 2 goes flying over the roof, but stops himself hitting the road by perforating t hood with his massive knife. He proceeds to perforate the wind screen with another knife that he extracts and (beca of laminate) starts to saw through the wind screen. The boys are in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandon ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two gets caught in a head lock by CHECHNYAN 2, they struggle. Mumbles hits the CHECHNYAN from behind with a c Jack and CHECHNYAN 2 goes down again. One Two's eyes have just about come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!     Run for your lives. The crew split in DIFFERENT DIRECTIONS. Bob takes the cas and plucks some poor bystander out of their car and takes off. Mumbles disappears another way. CHECHNYAN 2 is up an follows One Two - terminator style, a foot chase begins. One Two, split from the group and being pursued, jumps ov a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                           69A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two has ended up on a railway track. He turns back, w should CHECHNYAN 2 chase him, he hasn't got the money. Bu no, CHECHNYAN 2 is over the fence, bullet proof vest flap in the wind, and coming after him. One Two finds his stre this is his world, the world of the runner - he's off dow the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -    6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The pair of them are bleeding profusely, they're bashed t pulp, but they have still got a running sprit. The run go on and on. CHECHNYAN 2 has ripped off his jacket, we can see his massive scar covered torso dripping in blood and sweat, he seems unstoppable. One Two gets confident and starts to run backwards egging CHECHNYAN 2 on, CHECHNYAN is a good runner, but not good enough. Deep hate fills hi eyes as One Two makes a fool out of him, CHECHNYAN 2 will remember this man. One Two is taking complete liberties, almost stops and waits until CHECHNYAN 2 has caught up to him and then he tears off, the CHECHNYAN keeps coming. One Two see's in the distance a tiny moped approaching fr a distance, its CHECHNYAN 1 who completely out sizes the machine. However, he's moving and it's moving faster than One Two. One Two ducks off the tracks and over a wall, th moped gets nearer. At least when he gets over the wall, t moped won't follow right? One Two's over. He can hear the moped on the other side, One Two looks over his shoulder can see the moped being lifted over the wall. "Oh shit." This is where One Two's "zone" comes into play. He drifts in to a place that he can not be disturbed and he runs an runs and runs. Up, down, through and in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Mumbles has caught up with One Two along side the tracks. He is on a motorbike that he has stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two jumps on the back and they speed away leaving our Chechnyan's behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are on another one of Uri's construction sites, Lenny here to do the money exchange, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will have that painting   with you in a couple of days Uri.    It got locked up with some other   goods of mine, I wanted to keep it   safe, but Archy lost the key to the   lock. Didn't you Arch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archy nods like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I'm not being funny Uri, but I have a payment to make. So if there is any chance that I could get the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Victor walks up, there is something wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak to you Uri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uri concludes the meeting with Lenny and Archy and they w to the exit where Turbo is waiting by the door. Something has obviously just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong with these immigrants Arch, I don't fuckin trust 'em. We're being set up, don't know how, but something's wrong, I can smell it with my sniffer. I thought he was made of fuckin money, not too happy about flashing it around here though is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uri watches Lenny walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is the only one that knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have the balls or the brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a crook, a small time back handing crook. Once could be a coincidence, but twice and the painting - your "lucky painting" I think he is trying to make a fool out of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two walks into the restaurant with Handsome Bob. One Two is bashed to a pulp, but he's wearing a nice suit and carrying a bag full of money. There is a slight silence a his appearance arrests conversations. Handsome waits near the entrance and One Two sits down across from Stella, th is a pause. The odd PERSON passes and double takes at One Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                 71A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A WAITER walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a rhetorical question I hope. (to waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass of water thank you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a straw. (To Stella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to know what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what happened, it's been all over the news, but I didn't realize,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't say anything about guns,.. machine guns with war criminals stuck to the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry I didn't know, but shouldn't you have taken precautions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave your bag under the table all right? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this isn't about the money is it? I saw you there on that last job. At first I thought it was curiosity,.. CUT BACK TO THE ROBBERY we see Stella in her car that One Two had seen, but we didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then I realized what was going on. You don't need the money, you liked the rush. Your old man, can't give you the action can he? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye sweetheart you're too dangerous for me. He gets up and limps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two and Handsome get into the car where Mumbles, nurs his own wounds, is already waiting. Handsome sits in the drivers seat when his phone goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you Bertie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mumbles and One Two know what this call is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening about that drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening about that paper work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am busy tonight, but Monday looks good. I'll leave the papers at my reception under your name and text you the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be round in a jiffy and I'll see you Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone goes down, One Two narrows his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are scary good at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you miss it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Bob or I'll slap you. Go and pick up your paper work from your boy friend and drop me off on the way, I am going back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny is walking down the main corridor, he's a man on a mission. Archy is next to him, not looking so enthusiasti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch I don't care if he's fuckin busy, if we call, he answers, that's the deal. There he is,.. (shouting) Councilor,..Councilor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Councilor is walking down the corridor he's with some his COLLEAGUES. He looks mortified and beckons his friend on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong with your telephone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here Lenny?    You can't come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady, Councilor steady,...I go wherever I fuckin want. This is my town, not yours no matter what you and your pen pushing immigrant boy scouts might think. (pause) Now, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurriedly) Step in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Councilor steps into his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it, you've left it too long Lenny. You want something that the city has a ruling against, something they said they wouldn't give permission to build.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me that shit. I can look out my window and there's twenty kinds of buildings this city said they'd never build, how did that happen eh? Fuckin termites got together and had a house building party did they? No sunshine, back handers put them up, back handers just like mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't fuckin Zaire Lenny, I can't do it this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny grabs the Councilor by the bollocks and pushes him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off my bollocks Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squeezes the Councilors bollocks harder, the Councilor screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you swear at me you yellow puddle of immigrants piss or I'll fuckin drown you in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squeeze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel that do you Councilor? You think I don't have a paper trail for all the gifts, the cars, holidays, tennis courts and swimming pools? I own these bollocks and they're more fragile than a pair of quails eggs. Now get it done! (squeeze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And next time blue bollocks, remember who the Daddy is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny's sitting smoking a fag and watching more cartoons Pete walks in with Malcolm and Paul, Johnny jumps up angr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moron,...what do you think your doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letting creatures in my yard without my consent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're good stuff John, Scotch and Scouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the drink and the Beatles. I am Malcolm and this is my friend and colleague Paul, you know like the saint. Paul's still comatose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul doesn't say much, he's too busy thinking. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we know you John, we're big fans, you're what they call a real rocknrolla. Johnny cuts in and storms over to all three of them, push them out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out!! Good-bye, on your way, bon voyage and fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                            75

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pete falls to the floor sulking, Johnny can push no more it's a lay down, Malcolm and Paul join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this a laydown?     A fuckin demo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us be Johnny, we're nice people. Peaceful people. This is a demonstration of peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck did you find these two junkies? Conference, now Pete. Johnny drags Pete in toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro I swear this is the last time I'm having you take the piss, next time you're on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I thought you might like some company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am dead Pete, what does that tell you? It tells you, that dead people don't like company! Now jog 'em on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll tell 'em to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you fucking well will, smelly junkies. Meeting adjourned. Johnny and Pete walk out of the toilet, Malcolm and Paul gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've scared 'em off sing-a-long, but with a welcome like that it's not all that shocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky you're not following them. Johnny looks over, the picture has gone, he turns to Pete

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the picture Pete?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm and Paul walk in the speeler, it's packed.    Pau holding the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ho it's the werewolf brothers, what you got for us today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, please exhibit to the audience the fine artifact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks around with the painting - Malcolm sits him do he's in a state again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, now young Paul rest your weary legs. (beat. here comes the pitch) Gentlemen,...we are entering the realm of the ancient art form of paint on canvas,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cookie cuts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have it, how much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) One moment sir, there's a pitch that comes with this painting,....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cookie gets up from the table and walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want the pitch, I said I'll have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very rare and expensive painting sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm's upset, he wanted to give the pitch. Cookie pull out a lot of money too much for Malcolm to say no to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here ya go, have a week in snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon gentlemen, it's been a pleasure. I can hardly wait till the next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                            77

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Uri, Lenny and Victor are out on the fairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have that painting in a couple of days Uri, trust me on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uri's not sure about that last statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it out here Lenny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't beat the great outdoors can you Uri? I can't understand it, not a soul out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because I have had the course cleared for us Lenny, we are not going to be disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's good, I love a clear fair way, that's a bitta me that Uri. Nothing worse than being jogged on by blind tourists swinging a stick on a Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do Lenny? Every time I am about to make my payment something dishonest happens. (pause) You, wouldn't know anything about that, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly shifting gears, could he be saying what he thinks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Are you trying to say something Uri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not trying Lenny, I am saying something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny is not having any of this, after all he's "top dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you forget who you are speaking to you insolent bastard. You forget where you are you fuckin immigrant. This is my land, my fuckin show, I run this tow,....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                           78

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Victor has extracted a five iron from out of the golf bag and has decided to break both of Lenny's legs in ten diff places. Lenny screams in unimaginable agony, writhing on the green. Uri almost ignores the activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision   -   6-17-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go now Lenny, I am having lunch with the Councilor, your Councilor. This, as you know, is the ninth hole and it is a long crawl back to your car. You should make it by sunrise, just in time to bring me my "lucky picture." I want it back do you hear me? Victor kicks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes,..yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that, I don't want to hear from you again, disappear do you understand me Lenny? (Victor stands on his broken legs arrrrgh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, I understand. Victor dips into his Lenny's pocket and extracts his phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times just change. (Uri gets in the buggy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good bye Lenny. He gets into the buggy with Victor and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

"Let myself in, thought your lady would like the painting Love, Cookie" The door bell rings, he opens it and there stands Stella. She walks in straight past One Two, he turns round with h mouth open, she gently slaps it shut and kisses him.

dialogues.text: Well, who is it then?

dialogues.text: Who's Sidney Shaw?

dialogues.text: Sidney Shaw is a pseudonym you idiot, they never use the real name. Get around here and let me have a look.

dialogues.text: Give me the water, Aaaaaahhhhh,..

Now Johnny will come quietly, but you might have a couple of problems with the pipe. (he sighs) Come on boys, buy us both a cup of tea. No need for any noise, let Pete sleep on.

dialogues.text: Tell me, what are you boy if you are not poison? Look what you've left behind you. Your Dad couldn't even bear the sight ya, no wonder he fucked off and left me to pick up the pieces, but that wasn't enough for you was it? No, had to drive your mum into a bottle of pills and house full of nutters. All she got then was a hot bath a ice cold razor, why? (beat) Cos your poison Johnny, that's why.

dialogues.text: You're a dirty bastard Sidney, a very dirty bastard.

dialogues.text: Archy grabs the belt that's used to tie up drowning victi he throws it round Lenny's chair and stuffs a bit of clot into Lenny's wide open mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to One Two, Handsome Bob and Mumbles) You three, cut yourself free and get out of here,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archy throws a knife across to Mumbles who just catches i and starts to cut his way out of the ropes. Archy gets ba on with the job at hand. He reads through the names Lenny has grassed on over the years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Finny, ten years. Frazier Nash, fifteen years. Cousin Ronnie, six years,..you dirty bastard. (beat) Michael Dexter, eight years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archy grabs the winch that lowers victims to their crayfi death and bangs it on to the back of the wheel chair. He presses the start button and the wheelchair is raised wit haste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jew twins, fourteen years and of course ME, Archy, four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Two, Mumbles, and Handsome Bob are free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya Arch,....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them are out like rats up ropes, they start run down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pick up where we left off with this group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't have brought me here fellas, you're just going to end up as witnesses.

dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                            95

dialogues.text: We continue with his description of what is going to happ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After they have "dealt" with us, they're gonna put all three of us in the trunk of a stolen car,...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see six gallons of petrol in the trunk of the car in o imaginary scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pour six gallons of petrol on top, I can let your imagination fill in the rest.

dialogues.text: Back to present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now Danny's rattled, he won't be able to wait because you now know what's coming, so he's gonna fire. Danny, who is now in a state because Johnny has predicted everything he's going to do, suddenly turns with his gun. Mickey catches it, the force of the stop pulls the trigge and the other MANS head is drilled through. Roman joins t wrestling match and gets the gun and wrist to aim at Dann head. The trigger gets squeezed and Danny's head also get a drilling. Silence. Johnny, who is smothered in blood, speaks coolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey, pass me the gun. Mickey is out to lunch, but Johnny sounds commanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICKEY quickly, pass me that gun in Dannys hand. Don't worry he can't defend himself he doesn't have a head, quickly now. Does this answer the question that you two so frequently asked as to why I sought refuge in the depths and perverse beauty of the crack pipe? The elevator door opens.

dialogues.text: There stands Bandy, his gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get fucking down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks on in horror and points the gun at Johnny. Just he's about to fire,..there is a great smash of bone on ti Bandy falls to reveal One Two standing there with a large piece of timber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should get out of here now, don't you John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At which point in the background WE SEE Lenny being lower to his demise. He looks at the group in horror as he is quickly lowered to his death by drowning and cray fish. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it Uri, I don't trust her. I put two of my people on her and they haven't come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very insulted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what? I did not tell you to do this. If I had wanted her spied on I would have asked for it, wouldn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Uri, you would have, but I still don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you like Victor, I am in charge, now wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out and walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She answers the door - she is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                           97A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to surprise you, but I have something for you, a token of my appreciation. He hands her a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do not be insulted, you have come to mean a lot to me and I value you much more than just your services. (pause) This is simply a reflection of my appreciation. (vulnerable he likes her) I would like to ask you something personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His phone rings, he frowns slightly and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now Victor, I am busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uri turns. There, casually resting on the floor is his painting, his lucky painting. Uri's expression changes, h world has been shattered, he's thinking very ugly thought He turns back to Stella, dead pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very nice painting. How long have you had it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years, it's my lucky painting,... it's very special isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty is a cruel mistress, is it not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause, she smiles. Uri talks back into the phone, the oth darker Uri is now in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor please, come to join us.
